intro: Lagenocarpus sabanensis, commonly known as the Saban palm, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear yellowish-white flowers. Its fruits are small, round, and typically contain a single seed. Lagenocarpus sabanensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
